title: Quantum Mechanics I
description: First of two courses that develop the principles of quantum mechanics.  Topics include the state vector concept. Heisenberg and Schrodinger pictures, uncertainty relations, and exact solvable models in one dimension.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: PHYS 2213 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and (MATH 2403 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 2413 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 24X3 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of T or MATH 2552 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 2562 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 2X52 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of T)
